result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry J Weber Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Balance due is $579. Court grants payment plan of $100/mo commencing 5/15/16.  Failure to make payments when due will result in 1 day in the Ozaukee Co jail for every $25 outstanding.
Defendant to submit to a DNA sample at the Ozaukee Co Jail by 05/11/16

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Terry J Weber Jr
Current: 699 N Spring Street Apt 3, Random Lake, WI 53075   (Effective: 01-13-2016)
Prior: 723 Western Ave, Random Lake, WI 53075

Defendant Terry J Weber in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advises court he has had a pretrial conference with the DAs offer. Court provides defendant with plea questionnaire. Court breaks for defendant to fill out forms. 2:47 p.m. case recalled; same appearances. Defendant filed plea questionnaire. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.
w/conditions: no operation of a motor vehicle w/o license

Defendant Terry J Weber in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of penalties. State recommends signature bond and not to operate motor vehicle w/o valid dl. Court sets bail. Defendant files waiver of right to attorney. Court examines defendant on waiver and accepts said waiver.  Defendant to schedule pretrial conference with DAs office.  Further proceedings scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
